tourism_samples.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
tourism_samples.description: Sigiriya, also known as the Lion Rock, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring an ancient rock fortress, royal gardens, frescoes, and panoramic views of the central plains.

tourism_samples.title: Ella
tourism_samples.description: Ella is a peaceful hill-country town known for scenic train rides, lush tea plantations, the iconic Nine Arch Bridge, and hiking trails such as Ella Rock and Little Adam’s Peak.

tourism_samples.title: Galle Fort
tourism_samples.description: Galle Fort is a historic Dutch-built coastal fortress offering colonial architecture, museums, boutique shops, ocean views, and a charming blend of European and Sri Lankan culture.

tourism_samples.title: Temple of the Tooth Relic
tourism_samples.description: The Temple of the Tooth in Kandy is one of the most sacred Buddhist temples, housing a revered relic of the Buddha and featuring traditional rituals and cultural ceremonies.

tourism_samples.title: Yala National Park
tourism_samples.description: Yala National Park is Sri Lanka's most famous wildlife reserve, known for leopard sightings, elephants, crocodiles, and diverse bird species amid scenic dry-zone landscapes.

tourism_samples.title: Nuwara Eliya
tourism_samples.description: Nuwara Eliya, often called Little England, is famous for its cool climate, colonial buildings, tea estates, lakes, and scenic viewpoints in the central highlands.

tourism_samples.title: Mirissa Beach
tourism_samples.description: Mirissa is a tropical beach destination known for golden sands, clear waters, whale watching tours, snorkeling, and relaxed coastal atmosphere.

tourism_samples.title: Anuradhapura Sacred City
tourism_samples.description: Anuradhapura features ancient stupas, royal palaces, monasteries, and the sacred Sri Maha Bodhi tree, making it one of Sri Lanka’s most significant historical cities.

tourism_samples.title: Polonnaruwa Ancient City
tourism_samples.description: Polonnaruwa is a UNESCO World Heritage Site showcasing well-preserved temples, royal ruins, stone carvings, and the famous Gal Vihara Buddha statues.

tourism_samples.title: Trincomalee
tourism_samples.description: Trincomalee is a coastal city known for pristine beaches, the historic Koneswaram Temple, Fort Frederick, and excellent diving and snorkeling spots around Pigeon Island.
